reviews.review_msg: He is not clear about what he wants in lab. He didn't give our TA and heads up as to what we were doing in class that week so nothing was organised. Our class lucked out with a great TA otherwise we would have failed. George was often found scribbling notes for the lecture in the 10 min break in between classes and it showed

I think we became a failure "guinea pig" class. We are not given any lab manuals in the lab, and there is at least 1 instrument screw up when we are divided in to several groups.  Yes. if you listen carefully in his class the final is easy; I have never seen any analytical chemistry midterm/final that has no calculations tho (this is the 1st time)

You must listen carefull in lecture, and read ahead of time so you can come prepared with questions because the material can get a little hard to think about so suddenly in class. The exams make you put together all you knowledge and finalize your understanding of the topic. Very good professor and class
Nice teacher, but notes are not very good.  Best to take notes from text book.  No tricks on exams, just study his notes and your own from text books (Cannot study his notes alone).

In terms of teaching, he is definitely very dedicated to producing the future generation of chemists. He has a high standard on labs but you'll learn a lot. The course itself seems more engineering than chemistry due to focus on machine mechanisms of operation. Quizzes and exam were difficult but doable with good prep. He is great in office hours.

He changed the way the course and the lab were taught. He allowed the students to gain more experience and knowledge with the instruments. The reports were written formal reports, but he gave great feedback. The lectures related well to the lab, but they didn't always match up timing-wise. Overall, great class with him instead of anyone else!

Very caring teacher, makes effort learn everyone's name.  The lectures were based around the lab which made everything very practical.  Labs every week made sure we got lots of experience using instruments but also led to lots of homework for lab reports.  Overall not the easiest teachers but learnt more than most classes.

Really helpful when approached and asked questions where clarifications are needed. Study the notes provided in class and attend lecture. Exams are fair and everythig on the exams has been explained in class several times.

He's really friendly. The course is rather hard, but if you ask him, he will explain it throughly until you understand. Come to class, or else you miss the notes. Exam questions a bit tricky, but if you study well the text and notes, you'll be ok.
Friendly prof. He's very helpful when you go to his office or during the lab. NOTE: READ THE TEXTBOOK
She sends me spiraling into the great beyond. Might develop a drinking problem from her class.
Houston it's boots the house mother is deceased

Extremely disorganized and provided no clear guidelines for assignments/exams. Refused to fix a very obviously incorrect question on the midterm even after using the textbook as a reference. Definitely the worst experience I have had with a professor at sfu.

In conclusion, my experience with Dr. Sun was one of the worst I've had throughout my academic journey. Their lack of teaching skills, indifference toward student learning, and poor organization made the entire chemistry course a dreadful experience.

She was a very tough grader, did not give proper feedback to why something was inaccurate on the exam. Hard to reach out to her as she should always redirect you to TAs and is not knowledgeable in what is expected for lab reports. Unclear on what is expected since instructions from TA and from her are different. Don't take this class with her.
I like her~ she is very nice~
she is a good prof and i really like her!
easy class, exams are fair and easy. tells you what you need to know for exams - attend lectures! and book questions usually show up in the exams. Wouldnt mind taking another class with her
Awful class. Professor talks with a thick accent and always tries to give life lessons and fails to teach anything. Total hypocrite about things as well and sometimes childish about disagreements.
have a hard time in the class but my advice is hire a tutor instead.

All around awful class. No notes were posted. Lectures contained unrelated information. Constantly lectured us on how we were bad students. Did not provide problem sets or answers. Harsh marker. My lowest mark at SFU yet!
The class was so bad that she has to major scale all of our grade. Im happy that i pass at the end.
only picture in lecture notes, lecture focus with his personal knowledge which is not relevant with course. pop quizes almost every class. and no idea whats going to be on the midterm
strong accent. never have time for extra help. every class quiz. have a hard time in this class.
should avoid her because she does not post notes and expect a lot
